aas:langStringTextType.aas:text: defaultAdminShell

aas:langStringDefinitionTypeIec61360.aas:text: The SingleLevelBomAsSpecified defines the view of the OEM or producer of the whole product, e.g. the OEM of a vehicle. It is free of any supplier-related information and specifies the promised and guaranteed content of the whole product to the end customer. This "top-down" view is in contrast to the "bottom-up" view of the SingleLevelBoMAsPlanned, though several sub-aspects are shared. The BomAsSpecified is merely one aspect, which is attached to the twin of the whole product and itself does neither introduce further twins nor reference them. Instead it merely comprises all functional information required by dismantlers, workshops or requestors for used parts to search for and to make a match on the market place.

aas:langStringTextType.aas:text: The SingleLevelBomAsSpecified defines the view of the OEM or producer of the whole product, e.g. the OEM of a vehicle. It is free of any supplier-related information and specifies the promised and guaranteed content of the whole product to the end customer. This "top-down" view is in contrast to the "bottom-up" view of the SingleLevelBoMAsPlanned, though several sub-aspects are shared. The BomAsSpecified is merely one aspect, which is attached to the twin of the whole product and itself does neither introduce further twins nor reference them. Instead it merely comprises all functional information required by dismantlers, workshops or requestors for used parts to search for and to make a match on the market place.
A unique reference to an asset which could be registered within Catena-X DataSpace
The child Items of the observed parent item
Encapsulates the properties describing the child item

The BomAsSpecified defines the view of the OEM or producer of the whole product, e.g. the OEM of a vehicle. It is free of any supplier-related information and specifies the promised and guaranteed content of the whole product to the end customer. This "top-down" view is in contrast to the "bottom-up" view of the SingleLevelBoMAsPlanned, though several sub-aspects are shared. The BomAsSpecified is merely one aspect, which is attached to the twin of the whole product and itself does neither introduce further twins nor reference them. Instead it merely comprises all functional information required by dismantlers, workshops or requestors for used parts to search for and to make a match on the market place.
The description of the part in the primary language of the production facility of the product owner.
Entity encapsulating the properies describing a item

This is the key field of the component which usually keeps the part numbers used in after-sales, e.g. when repairing broken parts and searching for a replacement. This ownerPartId itself isn't usually bound to one part version, with the assumption that all part versions with the same ownerPartId are mutually interchangeable.

This is the version of the item. The engineering will at times supercede an older item version by a newer one, which might have different material aspects, physical dimensions etc., still maintaining compatibility.
The entity encapsulating the properties describing the quantity of a item.
Unit of measurement for the quantity of serialized objects.
The number of objects related to the measurement unit.
Unit of measurement for the quantity of serialized objects.
The number of objects related to the measurement unit.
The description of the item in the primary language of the production facility of the product owner.
The item classification.
The entity encapsulating the properties of the item classification.
Key within the classification.
Value within the classification.
The time the item was modified the last time
The time the item was created on

Some parts are intended to be used on either the left or right side, e.g. mirrors, hence this entity describes on which side a part is to be used

The BomAsSpecified defines the view of the OEM or producer of the whole product, e.g. the OEM of a vehicle. It is free of any supplier-related information and specifies the promised and guaranteed content of the whole product to the end customer. This "top-down" view is in contrast to the "bottom-up" view of the SingleLevelBoMAsPlanned, though several sub-aspects are shared. The BomAsSpecified is merely one aspect, which is attached to the twin of the whole product and itself does neither introduce further twins nor reference them. Instead it merely comprises all functional information required by dismantlers, workshops or requestors for used parts to search for and to make a match on the market place.

The ID of the initial issuer of the single level BoMAsSpecified

The SingleLevelBomAsSpecified defines the view of the OEM or producer of the whole product, e.g. the OEM of a vehicle. It is free of any supplier-related information and specifies the promised and guaranteed content of the whole product to the end customer. This "top-down" view is in contrast to the "bottom-up" view of the SingleLevelBoMAsPlanned, though several sub-aspects are shared. The BomAsSpecified is merely one aspect, which is attached to the twin of the whole product and itself does neither introduce further twins nor reference them. Instead it merely comprises all functional information required by dismantlers, workshops or requestors for used parts to search for and to make a match on the market place.
